description: Reading and discussion of writings that ultimately go back to oral traditions, including chapbooks
such as the Nibelungenlied, Till Eulenspiegel, and Faust, fables created on
models from antiquity during the eighteenth century, fairy tales collected by the Brothers Grimm,
and Kunstm√§rchen (literary fairy tales by known writers). The course emphasizes both the
literary aspects of the works and their historical contexts.
fullname: Fairy Tales, Folktales and Fables (in English)
